newsitem.title: USA: Computer Associates to sponsor "Dilbert" in WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Computer Associates to sponsor "Dilbert" in WSJ.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc said on Wednesday that it will sponsor a weekly appearance of the "Dilbert" comic strip in the Wall Street Journal, beginning on Thursday.
The strip by Scott Adams will run each Thursday in the newspaper's Marketplace section, in space paid for as an advertisement by Computer Associates.

"Dilbert" is a syndicated strip that pokes fun at various workplace practices. The strips presented by Computer Associates in the Journal all will be high-tech related, chosen from an archive of previously published Dilberts.
The Journal, owned by Dow Jones & Co Inc, usually does not run comic strips on its own, Computer Associates said.
